image.altText: Calvary St Luke's Hospital sign.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian healthcare experts are calling for assurances about the future of a private hospital in Launceston in the wake of a costly infrastructure failure.

title.children: Private hospital's future under scrutiny after major infrastructure failure

image.altText: Ariarne Titmus waves to the crowd

props.synopsis: Ariarne Titmus draws the curtain on a decorated career, in which she won eight medals across two Olympic Games.

title.children: Olympic swimming champion Titmus explains shock retirement

image.altText: Big red ship docked in water

props.synopsis: The ABC understands that a recent safety assessment found the interim berth would need two additional bollards for the ship to dock there at a cost of $2 million, an option which may not go ahead.

title.children: Spirit of Tasmania IV ship unable to dock at interim berth at Point Henry in Geelong

image.altText: a heritage home in need of repair

props.synopsis: In northern Tasmania, Woolmers Estate is recognised for its heritage charm. But buckets to catch drips and cracks in walls show how that could change.

title.children: Time feels frozen inside Woolmers Estate, but the cracks are beginning to show

image.altText: Members of the Wik community walk in grassy field

props.synopsis: Being one of Australia’s most remote and disadvantaged communities, Aurukun’s grocery prices are some of the highest in the country.

title.children: The 'ridiculous' $1,000 weekly shop for remote Cape York community

image.altText: a woman uses shovelling dirt into a grave with other people standing around

props.synopsis: Funerals begin for dead Israelis returned from Gaza in the ceasefire and hostage exchange deal, as the nation receives the remains of two more former captives.

title.children: First dead Israeli hostage buried as two more bodies released

image.altText: Michele Bullock stands at podium

props.synopsis: The Australian dollar falls sharply and the ASX jumps after a steep rise in unemployment revives bets on a November interest rate cut. Follow the latest on our live markets blog.

title.children: Dollar drops, ASX surges as unemployment jump revives rate cut bets

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Treasurer responds to rise in unemployment
'Reserve Bank would be foolish not to cut rates' in November
November rate cut now a clear favourite after shocking September jobs data

image.altText: A blonde woman with light pink lipstick, earrings, long eyelashes wearing a white top

props.synopsis: Police have uncovered human remains in bushland in Victoria's east believed to be missing woman Lucinda Miller.

title.children: Remains of missing woman found three years to the day after disappearance

image.altText: Donald Trump in a blue suit and red tie speaks into a microphone

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says he authorised the CIA operation in part to stop the flow of "drugs coming in from Venezuela".

title.children: Trump confirms CIA conducting covert operations inside Venezuela

image.altText: People on the streets of Singapore

props.synopsis: Businesses in Singapore — one of the most trade-exposed economies in the world — have been watching the fallout from Donald Trump's 'Liberation Day' tariffs with apprehension.

title.children: Singapore was hit with a 10pc US tariff but the fallout reaches further

image.altText: Josh Lees from Palestine Action Group

props.synopsis: The Palestine Action Group has won a NSW Supreme Court challenge against a law that limited protests near places of worship.

title.children: Court rules in favour of Palestine Action Group over NSW protest laws

image.altText: Soldiers in jumpsuits stand in formation on tarmac in front of a large reconnaisance plane.

props.synopsis: Australia's most sophisticated military surveillance plane was deployed 45 times next to Ukraine in the last three months as part of NATO efforts to monitor Russian activity.

title.children: Australian spy plane deployed 45 times during mission to help Ukraine

image.altText: Man stands next to Chinese flag at a podium

props.synopsis: Trump may have expressed "shock", but his administration is clearly not surprised at China's willingness to flex its dominance on rare earths.

title.children: Beijing's latest move shocked Trump but Australia sees an opportunity

image.altText: A headshot of Sussan Ley speaking.

props.synopsis: Sussan Ley says she's not concerned about reports that some Liberal MPs are considering defecting to the Nationals over climate and energy policy. Follow live.

title.children: Ley 'not at all' concerned Liberal MPs could defect to Nationals

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Opposition leader brushes aside reports Liberal MPs could defect to Nationals
New powers to crack down on crypto ATMs on the way
Surprise spike in Australia's unemployment rate to 4.5 per cent

image.altText: Matt, left, sits on a bench outside while Kate stands with her arms around him, both smiling proudly.

props.synopsis: Kate and Matt knew they had to do things differently if they ever wanted to live in their dream home. Not only did they swap the city for regional Tasmania and build a house using recycled bottles — they also relied on volunteers.

title.children: Priced out of Melbourne, this family built an earthship

image.altText: A laptop computer sits open on a bed in a dark room showing an email account on screen.

props.synopsis: A Perth man has described how having his all his electronic devices hacked has up-ended his life and left him feeling like "someone has walked into my bedroom with a knife".

title.children: Public wi-fi a major cause of hacking, consumer affairs authorities warn

image.altText: Serious woman sits in a garden, holds a book, title Bindi, up, lots of books scattered on table in front.

props.synopsis: The rapid development of AI is testing the effectiveness of the Copyright Act, with creative and media industries calling for better protections.

title.children: First Nations artists warn against AI 'double colonisation'

image.altText: A man standing next to the Balibo Five sign.

props.synopsis: On the 50th anniversary of the Balibo Five murders, families are still grieving the loss of their loved ones and remain committed to holding those responsible accountable for their actions.

title.children: 'It still hurts': Families seek justice 50 years since the Balibo Five murders

image.altText: A large LNG tank sits among mangrove trees, Darwin's skyline is visible in the background

props.synopsis: Santos's Darwin gas plant is set for a new lease of life despite a major methane leak. The company told federal officials the risk it could be forced to meet best practice on carbon emissions was "intolerable".

title.children: Prospect of net zero an 'intolerable risk' for leaking Santos plant

image.altText: GettyImages-2205357933

props.synopsis: It was one of the more chaotic AFL trade periods on record as picks and players moved all over the place — but who came out ahead the most?

title.children: Which team 'won' the AFL trade period — and does free agency need a fix?

image.altText: A small fluffy dog in a pet carrier container.

props.synopsis: Pets under 8 kilograms can now travel inside the passenger cabin on selected flights between Melbourne and the Gold and Sunshine Coasts.

title.children: Pets on planes trial takes first flight

image.altText: A model of a rock shelter, with a small model person placed adjacent for scale

props.synopsis: A full-scale replica of the Juukan Gorge rock shelter, destroyed by mining company Rio Tinto, will be built over the remains of the original in Western Australia's north.

title.children: Inside the ambitious plan to fill void left by Juukan Gorge destruction

image.altText: Woman shearing a lamb, with others watching on

props.synopsis: Nikki Lyons's clippers started humming at 6am. Twelve hours later, she was a world record holder.

title.children: Woman shears 502 merino lambs in nine hours to claim world record

image.altText: a blurred photo of a six-year-old boy with a shaved head

props.synopsis: A South Australian woman has pleaded guilty to 11 charges after she faked her six-year-old son's cancer diagnosis in a bid to raise more than $11,000.

title.children: Mother who faked son's cancer diagnosis pleads guilty to 11 charges

image.altText: A composite image with headshots of Anthony Albanese and Donald Trump.

props.synopsis: New polling shows most Australians want to stick with the US alliance, despite holding overwhelmingly negative views towards the Trump administration and harbouring deep worries about the erosion of American democracy.

title.children: Aussies stick with US in new poll despite disliking Trump

image.altText: a tarmac worker helps guide a poseidon plane

props.synopsis: The federal government has re-established the Number 12 Squadron in SA at the same time as Australia's anti-submarine capability is expanding with the arrival of new aircraft.

title.children: Historic squadron rebooted ahead of Albanese-Trump meeting

image.altText: An aerial view of dry, arid ground with dirt tracks where four-year-old Gus went missing

props.synopsis: More than 100 people, including from SA Police, the Australian Defence Force, and the State Emergency Services, have been walking about 20 kilometres per day in hot conditions during the renewed search, police say. The search concluded about midday on Thursday.

title.children: Third day of renewed search for missing 4yo Gus wraps up amid extreme heat

image.altText: A medium sized black white and yellow honeyeater sitting on a branch.

props.synopsis: Dozens of regent honeyeaters have been released in woodlands in the NSW Hunter Valley in an effort to boost the critically endangered population.

title.children: Zoo-bred birds released to save one of Australia's rarest species

image.altText: Half of a white metal hull with debris around it lies on the ocean floor, with blue water and harsh light

props.synopsis: A report has found the owner failed to adequately test the Titan submersible and was unaware of its true durability before it imploded in 2023, killing five people.

title.children: Faulty engineering led to Titan submersible implosion

image.altText: A man carries a box through a car park near a large building. Men and woman walk in a loose procession behind him.

props.synopsis: Journalists working at the Pentagon had been asked to sign a pledge to refrain from reporting information not authorised for release by the US Department of War.

title.children: Journalists turn in press passes, exit Pentagon over new reporting rules

image.altText: A drawing of an unhappy person with tangled thoughts floating from their mind.

props.synopsis: October marks Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) awareness month and the focus this year is on the many faces of the neurological condition.

title.children: Australian diagnoses are 'on the rise', but what does ADHD actually mean?

image.altText: A man wears a tan-coloured trench coat and another man wears a white suit and tie in a composite image

props.synopsis: The collapse of the case against the men — a former think-tank director and a researcher for a senior MP — prompts some to argue the British government deliberately failed to provide enough evidence against the pair in order to avoid upsetting China.

title.children: How two words unravelled cases against two suspected Chinese spies

image.altText: A young macaque monkey in a cage holds a banana

props.synopsis: Macaque monkeys introduced under German colonial rule have overrun Angaur in Palau. Now in the thousands, the monkeys are causing cultural and environmental upheaval.

title.children: How mines, bombs and US military plans fuel a monkey island takeover
